channel.title: What operating system should I get?
channel.description:
Which operating system should I get? If u say linux say which one
My comp is ready since recently system32 became corrupted and I am going to take advantage of this opportunity to try a diff operating system
I'm looking for an op system that my whole family can use.w

item.title: What operating system should I get?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“mapu, post:18, topic:363831”]Well I may dual boot with it then. I tried ubuntu but it required me to have to install BASIC shit myself. If this has the basic shit already it looks as though I may be in business.[/quote]Ubuntu comes with a whole ton of stuff, I usually uninstall at least half of the things that come with a base Ubuntu installation.

Read full topic
item.source: What operating system should I get?

item.title: What operating system should I get?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

mapu:

Well I may dual boot with it then. I tried ubuntu but it required me to have to install BASIC shit myself. If this has the basic shit already it looks as though I may be in business.

What basic stuff are you talking about? It comes with many, many more things than windows from the start, and you install thing by checking boxes in synaptic.

Read full topic
item.source: What operating system should I get?

item.title: What operating system should I get?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

Anything but a Mac. Some might think it’s great for editing, but my school has a lab of those really fancy ones with the default purple majestic background with a lot of aero action going on, and even though they may seem to be fast, the window system is horrible along with navigation and general usability of the operating system. Biggest mistake you could make (Next to Vista).

Read full topic
item.source: What operating system should I get?

item.description:
@mapu wrote:

Well I may dual boot with it then. I tried ubuntu but it required me to have to install BASIC shit myself. If this has the basic shit already it looks as though I may be in business.

item.source: What operating system should I get?

item.title: What operating system should I get?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“mapu, post:15, topic:363831”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=460073.msg3367784#msg3367784 date=1286932573]

thanks guys but i settled on kubuntu its great thanks mopar

Awesome, glad you like it.
[/quote]
What is the setup time for it to make usability the equivalent of a basic windows system? The only problem with linux for me is it doesn’t come pre-ready for porn/flash.[/quote]

It installs faster than windows and is all set up from the get-go.

noobs are ftw:

I just can’t seem to get java to work on it

Ubuntu messed that up on purpose with the last release, here is how to get sun’s java easily:
http://www.ubuntugeek.com/how-install-sun-java-runtime-environment-jre-in-ubuntu-10-04-lucid-lynx.html

Read full topic

@moparisthebest wrote:

item.title: What operating system should I get?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
read this, if you agree then download Arch Linux

I would install win 7 to accompany arch since there are certain things that you just need windows for and wine does not suffice.

ps, xfce xfce xfce xfce
kde4 sux

Read full topic
